description: Surprise, surprise – to no one, Gordon Ramsay is the most popular chef in the world. The ultra-famous chef and TV personality is probably the most well-known celebrity chef ever. His career includes a total of 16 (!) Michelin stars, numerous awards, and a long list of popular TV shows, including Hell’s Kitchen, MasterChef US, and Kitchen Nightmares, which have inspired endless memes.Ramsay is well-known for his cooking talent, his on-screen charisma, and his fiery temper – there is a lot of beeping going on whenever he makes a TV appearance, that’s all we’re going to say.

recipes.cooking_method: Boil the spaghetti until al dente. In a separate pan, cook the pancetta until crispy. Beat the eggs and mix in grated Parmesan cheese. Drain the spaghetti and mix with the pancetta. Remove the pan from heat and add the egg mixture. Toss well and add black pepper to taste.

Sear the beef tenderloin in a hot pan. In a separate pan, sauté mushrooms until they release their liquid. Spread Dijon mustard on prosciutto and wrap around the beef. Lay out puff pastry and add the mushroom mixture. Place the beef on top and wrap the pastry around it. Brush with egg wash and bake in the oven until golden brown.

description: The Emmy-award-winning American restaurateur is one of the most beloved TV personalities in the biz – and one of the most prolific. He’s featured in various cooking programs on the Food Network, such as Guy’s Big Bite, Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, and Minute to Win It.

Sear the beef tenderloin in a hot pan. In a separate pan, sauté mushrooms until they release their liquid. Spread Dijon mustard on prosciutto and wrap around the beef. Lay out puff pastry and add the mushroom mixture. Place the beef on top and wrap the pastry around it. Brush with egg wash and bake in the oven until golden brown.

descripton: In 2017, Michael Caines opened Lympstone Manor, a luxurious country house and hotel built around a historic 1760’s estate in East Devon. Caines dedicated three years of his life to transforming the Georgian mansion into a world-class destination for food lovers.
